original_data.question: A 58-year-old man comes to the physician because he is unable to achieve erections during sexual intercourse. He first noticed the problem 8 months ago, when he became sexually active with a new girlfriend. He states that his relationship with his girlfriend is good, but his inability to engage in sexual intercourse has been frustrating. He has hyperlipidemia and was diagnosed with major depressive disorder 3 years ago. He works as a lawyer and enjoys his job, but he has had a great deal of stress lately. He had not been sexually active for the previous 3 years, since the death of his wife. He does not smoke. He drinks 4–6 beers on weekends. Current medications include simvastatin and citalopram. His temperature is 37.5°C (99.5°F), pulse is 80/min, and blood pressure is 135/82 mm Hg. BMI is 30 kg/m2. Pedal pulses are difficult to palpate. The remainder of the physical examination shows no abnormalities. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in management?

model_response:
The patient's depression and hyperlipidemia are well controlled with citalopram and simvastatin, respectively. His lack of sexual desire is likely due to the major depressive disorder, which is currently well treated. The patient should be educated about the side effects of citalopram, which include decreased libido and orgasmic dysfunction. The patient should be reassured that these side effects often diminish over time. He should be counseled about stress reduction and lifestyle modification. He should also be educated about nocturnal penile tumescence testing, which can document whether he has normal nocturnal erections. This testing can help to distinguish between psychogenic erectile dysfunction and erectile dysfunction due to organic causes, such as vascular disease or neuropathy. The patient should be encouraged to continue regular exercise and to maintain a healthy diet. He should also be educated about the possibility of using a penile prosthesis or of applying topical vasodilators.


Answer: OPTION C IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: Human males as cultural, psychological, sociological, political, and economic entities.
Having a black or dark core or plug.
Individuals licensed to practice medicine.

The state of the PENIS when the erectile tissue becomes filled or swollen (tumid) with BLOOD and causes the penis to become rigid and elevated. It is a complex process involving CENTRAL NERVOUS SYSTEM; PERIPHERAL NERVOUS SYSTEMS; HORMONES; SMOOTH MUSCLES; and vascular functions.
The sexual union of a male and a female, a term used for human only.
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.
One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
A response indicating that an individual is or was sexually active.
A girl or woman who is the lover of a boy or man.
A constituent administrative district of a nation.
A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.
A girl or woman who is the lover of a boy or man.
Inadequate personal response to problems or difficulties
In a formal agreement for marriage.
The sexual union of a male and a female, a term used for human only.
The motivational and/or affective state resulting from being blocked, thwarted, disappointed or defeated.
Conditions with excess LIPIDS in the blood.

The determination of the nature of a disease or condition, or the distinguishing of one disease or condition from another. Assessment may be made through physical examination, laboratory tests, or the likes. Computerized programs may be used to enhance the decision-making process.
An affective disorder manifested by either a dysphoric mood or loss of interest or pleasure in usual activities. The mood disturbance is prominent and relatively persistent.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
Persons whose profession is to give legal advice and assistance to clients and represent them in legal matters. (American Heritage Dictionary, 3d ed)
A question about whether an individual's pet enjoys life.
Crafts, trades, professions, or other means of earning a living.
The negative mental, emotional, and physical reactions that occur when environmental stressors are perceived as exceeding the individual's adaptive capacities.
A response indicating that an individual is or was sexually active.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
Irreversible cessation of all bodily functions, manifested by absence of spontaneous breathing and total loss of cardiovascular and cerebral functions.
A female partner in marriage.
Visible gaseous suspension of carbon and other particulate matter emitted from burning substances.
A single serving of a beverage; any liquid suitable for drinking.
An alcoholic beverage usually made from malted cereal grain (as barley), flavored with hops, and brewed by slow fermentation.
The time period comprising Saturday and Sunday, and sometimes considered to include Friday night.
Drugs intended for human or veterinary use, presented in their finished dosage form. Included here are materials used in the preparation and/or formulation of the finished dosage form.

A derivative of LOVASTATIN and potent competitive inhibitor of 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl coenzyme A reductase (HYDROXYMETHYLGLUTARYL COA REDUCTASES), which is the rate-limiting enzyme in cholesterol biosynthesis. It may also interfere with steroid hormone production. Due to the induction of hepatic LDL RECEPTORS, it increases breakdown of LDL CHOLESTEROL.

A furancarbonitrile that is one of the SELECTIVE SEROTONIN REUPTAKE INHIBITORS used as an antidepressant. The drug is also effective in reducing ethanol uptake in alcoholics and is used in depressed patients who also suffer from TARDIVE DYSKINESIA in preference to tricyclic antidepressants, which aggravate dyskinesia.
The measure of the level of heat of a human or animal.
The rhythmical expansion and contraction of an ARTERY produced by waves of pressure caused by the ejection of BLOOD from the left ventricle of the HEART as it contracts.
PRESSURE of the BLOOD on the ARTERIES and other BLOOD VESSELS.
A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.
Application of fingers with light pressure to the surface of the body to determine consistence of parts beneath in physical diagnosis; includes palpation for determining the outlines of organs.
Systematic and thorough inspection of the patient for physical signs of disease or abnormality.
Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.
